channel.title: JavaScript Weekly
channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: „ÄêIt's time to go ESM-only„ÄëÊòØÊó∂ÂÄôÂéªESM‰∫Ü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã723 ‚Äî February 14, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Style Observer: A Library to Observe CSS Property Changes ‚Äî Lea¬†Verou is a developer who‚Äôs easy to admire because whenever she sets out to solve a problem, the results are always fully formed with no cut corners. So it goes with this ‚Äòexhaustively tested‚Äô JS library for observing changes to CSS properties which deftly handles lots of browser quirks. See the project homepage for more. (TIL there‚Äôs a .style TLD!)

Lea Verou

üí° Lea has many other projects to check out, including Color.js which similarly nails the whole process of handling and manipulating colors in JS and the¬†browser.

Build Better with AWS, Using Tips and Tools from the Developer Center ‚Äî Get hands-on with DevOps, Data & ML, and Generative AI. Use any language, level up your skills. Connect with like-minded devs all over the world on AWS Communities. The AWS Developer Center has everything you need in one place. Don‚Äôt miss¬†out!

AWS sponsor

Why to Move On to 'ESM-Only' ‚Äî The march to using ES modules has been going on for years, but if you‚Äôre still holding out, there‚Äôs probably a good reason why? However, while you can maintain packages supporting both ESM and CommonJS, Anthony thinks it‚Äôs time to go ‚ÄòESM only‚Äô and explains¬†why.

Anthony Fu

üí° On that topic, Sarah Gooding writes about require(esm) being backported and stable on Node.js 20 which makes the transition even easier to¬†justify.

IN BRIEF:

  • ü§î Developer industry analyst Kate Holterhoff asks "Is npm enough?" and questions why there are so many attempts to replace or extend npm in the JS package registry¬†space.

  • üì± The React Native team has a roundup of what happened at the most recent contributor summit. Must read for React Native¬†devs.

  • The Popover API is now considered a 'baseline' browser feature with broad support across all major¬†browsers.

  • ü§ñ Reader Ishan Anand has been working on implementing GPT2 (a precursor to OpenAI's current offerings) entirely in the browser to power some interesting browser-based spreadsheet data processing experiments.

RELEASES:

  • Node.js v23.8.0 (Current) and Node.js v22.14.0 (LTS)

  • Node.js v20.18.3 (LTS) ‚Äì The backporting of import attributes and JSON modules is now¬†stable.

  • pnpm 10.3 ‚Äì The fast, efficiency-focused package¬†manager adds a strict-dep-builds option to exit with a non-zero exit code if any dependencies have unreviewed build¬†scripts.

  • Pixi.js 8.8 ‚Äì Fast, flexible 2D WebGL¬†renderer.

  • Astro 5.3, Prettier 3.5, Electron 34.2

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

How and Why to Build 'Copy Code' Buttons ‚Äî A commonly encountered way to give readers easier access to source shared on the¬†Web. David Bushell has an interesting followup reflecting on his own experiences implementing the same¬†feature.

Salma Alam-Naylor

The RegExp Escaping ECMAScript Proposal ‚Äî RegExp.escape() is a function to create an escaped version of a supplied text that matches itself when used as, or in, a regular expression. Axel has also written an implementation in plain¬†JS to get a feel for how it¬†works.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Build a Next.js Sign-Up Form with React Hook Form ‚Äî Features progressive enhancement, dynamic validation, and secure password handling with¬†Argon2.

Clerk sponsor

How to Start a React Project in 2025 ‚Äî While there are many ways to start a React project, Robin examines the pros and cons of a few popular¬†approaches.

Robin Wieruch

Learning How to Build Modern Web Extensions ‚Äî It‚Äôs easy to run into outdated docs when building extensions. Lucky for us, Hui has been through the process and shares some¬†tips.

Hui Jing

Testing 10 JavaScript Frameworks on Their HTML Defaults ‚Äî Using a JavaScript framework is now ‚Äòthe way‚Äô for many Web site developers, but how do the popular options fare at producing valid, error free¬†HTML?

Jens Oliver Meiert

üìÑ Using Intl.DurationFormat for Localized Durations Raymond Camden

üìÑ How to Refactor Code with GitHub Copilot Anthony Grutta (GitHub)

üìÑ Using RxDB as a Database in a Vue.js Application RxDB

üìÑ Supporting Pasting Files into the Browser Fileber

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Ohm: A Parsing Toolkit for JavaScript and TypeScript ‚Äî It‚Äôs been a few years since we covered this project and it‚Äôs come along a lot. It‚Äôs a library for building PEG-based parsers you can use in interpreter, compilers, analysis tools, etc. and you can even play with its grammar¬†online.

Warth, Dubroy, et al.

Start Selling to Enterprise Faster with WorkOS ‚Äî Add SSO, SCIM, and RBAC to your B2B SaaS app in minutes‚Äînot¬†months.

WorkOS sponsor

Human Regex: Human-Friendly Regular Expression Builder with English¬†Syntax ‚Äî After 8 years of Perl, regexes are my friend, but most developers aren‚Äôt big fans? This library offers a natural, fluent approach. Magic Regexp and Super Expressive are alternatives to¬†consider.

Ridwan Ajibola

Svader: Create GPU-Rendered Svelte Components ‚Äî The examples are a good way to get a feel for what this¬†offers.

Holger Dal Mogensen

web-worker 1.5: Consistent Web Workers for the Browser and Node ‚Äî Want to publish npm modules that use Web Workers and that work in both Node and client-side? In Node, it works as a web-compatible Worker implementation atop worker_threads. In the browser, it‚Äôs an alias for Worker.

Jason Miller

The React Data Table I Always Wanted ‚Äî A look into a particularly fast and clean shadcn/ui-based data table component (GitHub repo). See a live¬†demo.

Maximilian Kaske

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Telling the Bit story: Celebrating 10 Years of Composability. Ran Mizrahi reveals how Bit shifted from development stagnation to exponential progress using¬†Composability.

ü§Ø Pfft, vehicle data is a joke without CarsXE. API goes brrrrr. VIN decoding, plate lookup, market value reports. Get¬†Serious!

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many¬†more.

Other PDF SDKs promise a lot ‚Äî then break at scale. Nutrient‚Äôs SDK doesn't, handling billion-page workloads for over 10k devs ‚Äî meaning you don‚Äôt have to debug¬†PDFs.

  • Kaluma 1.2 ‚Äì Tiny JavaScript runtime for the RP2040 (Raspberry Pi¬†Pico).

  • bcrypt.js 3.0 ‚Äì Optimized bcrypt in pure JS. Even in the¬†browser.

  • Jasmine 5.6 ‚Äì Testing framework for browsers &¬†Node.

  • ü§ñ Midscene.js 0.11 ‚Äì Let AI be your browser operator.

üî†¬†And a little typography bonus

GitHub Extends Its Monaspace Font Family ‚Äî Monaspace is a fantastic set of monospaced fonts from GitHub targeted at coding use cases. Its new v1.2 release ups the ante by including Nerd Fonts support and symbols, new box drawing glyphs, characters, character variants, ligatures, and¬†more.

GitHub

item.title: „ÄêThe current state of JavaScript on the Web„ÄëÁΩëÁªú‰∏äJavaScriptÁöÑÂΩìÂâçÁä∂ÊÄÅ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã726 ‚Äî March 7, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Report on How the Web is Really Using JavaScript ‚Äî Each year, the HTTP Archive puts together the Web Almanac, a report on the ‚Äòstate of the Web‚Äô. The JavaScript section has just gone live and goes into depth on how much JS we‚Äôre using (or failing to use!), the popularity of TypeScript, loading methods, Web Worker use, and, yes, jQuery still leads the¬†way!

HTTP Archive

Lynx: A Fresh Way to Build Apps from Web Technologies ‚Äî Lynx is a new set of tools for building JavaScript-powered native and Web apps that draws inspiration from React Native but aims to be more modular and flexible (and eventually framework agnostic). It comes from, and is used by, TikTok, and comes with its own QuickJS-based JavaScript¬†engine.

Xuan Huang and the Lynx Team

Build Dynamic Forms with a JSON-Powered White-Label Form Builder ‚Äî Create fully customizable, JSON-driven forms in your JavaScript app with SurveyJS. Our drag-and-drop form-building UI component integrates seamlessly with React, Angular, Vue 3, and vanilla JS, plus has no backend restrictions. Perfect for form-heavy¬†apps.

SurveyJS sponsor

Announcing TypeScript 5.8 ‚Äî Four months in the making, TypeScript 5.8 lands with a strong Node focus. You can now use require() for ES modules in the nodenext module, there‚Äôs a new node18 module for developers who want to keep targeting Node 18, and most notably there‚Äôs now an --erasableSyntaxOnly option to ensure no TypeScript-only runtime semantics can be¬†used.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • The Svelte team shares its latest monthly update of what's new.

  • Straightforward examples of basic design patterns implemented in pure JavaScript.

  • ü§ñ The folks behind the State of JS survey are running State of Web Dev AI, a new survey focused on the use of AI in modern Web¬†development.

RELEASES:

  • Electron 35.0 ‚Äì You can now attach a preload script to Service Workers. Dependencies are also bumped to Chromium 134 and Node¬†22.14.

  • Angular 19.2 ‚Äì We mentioned this last week but there's now an official post with more¬†details.

  • React Aria March Release ‚Äì Adobe's fantastic suite of React¬†components.

  • zx 8.4 ‚Äì Google's tool for better Node shell¬†scripting.

  • eslint-plugin-vue v10.0.0, Readability.js 0.6, NodeBB 4.1

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

JavaScript Fatigue Strikes Back ‚Äî A developer with ‚Äòa decade away‚Äô from writing JavaScript returns to find that one thing hasn‚Äôt changed: ‚ÄúChoosing the right JavaScript framework is hard, man.‚Äù

Allen Pike

Dr. Axel's 'Sales Pitch' for TypeScript ‚Äî As one of JavaScript‚Äôs most esteemed writers, if Dr. Axel can‚Äôt convince you of the value of TypeScript, who¬†could?

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Instrument, Monitor, Fix: A Hands-On Debugging Class ‚Äî Join us for a hands-on session where you‚Äôll build it, watch it break, debug it, and go from ‚Äúno idea what‚Äôs wrong‚Äù to fixing¬†issues.

Sentry sponsor

Reimplementing Crossy Road in JavaScript ‚Äî Two well put together tutorials so far covering reimplementing Crossy Road with either Three.js or React Three Fiber. In both written or video¬†form.

Hunor M√°rton Borb√©ly

Node Just Added TypeScript Support. What Does That Mean for¬†Deno? ‚Äî The Deno team, who went all in on TypeScript from day one, reflects on the continued increase in levels of support for TypeScript in Node and how their approaches¬†differ.

Andy Jiang and Ryan Dahl

üìÑ Creating an Image Comparison Slider in 6 Lines of JavaScript Muffin Man

üìÑ Is Biome Ready to Replace Prettier and ESLint? Nicolas Pendon

üìÑ Speeding Up the JS Ecosystem with Rust and JavaScript Plugins Marvin Hagemeister

üìÑ JavaScript Best Practice: Use return await Tam√°s Sallai

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

TanStack Form v1.0: Headless, Type-Safe Form State Management ‚Äî A type-safe, framework agnostic (React, Vue, Angular, Solid and Lit are all supported out of the box), headless and isomorphic way to create and work with forms, with this v1.0 release over two years in the making. If you already use things like Formik or React Hook Form and are wondering how it differs, here‚Äôs a comparison¬†table.

Tanner Linsley

PDFSlick 2.2: View and Interact with PDF Documents ‚Äî A full-featured PDF viewer for React, Solid, Svelte and other JS apps. Built on top of PDF.js, it uses Zustand to provide a reactive store for documents. Demo.

Vancho Stojkov

üîí Protect Against AI Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

Electron App Boilerplate with Modern Dependencies ‚Äî A basic template app that uses React 19, Tailwind CSS 4, shadcn/ui, Electron Vite, Biome, and includes a GitHub Actions release¬†workflow.

Dalton Menezes

Fable: A F# to JavaScript Compiler ‚Äî If you fancy F#‚Äôs flavor of almost-entirely-functional development, this could be for you. GitHub¬†repo.

Fable

React Data Table: Responsive Dynamic Table Component ‚Äî Simple and clean, but flexible. Includes features like column sorting and pagination out of the box. Lots of demos and code examples. GitHub¬†repo.

John Betancur

  • üñºÔ∏è Cropper.js 2.0 ‚Äì JavaScript image cropping control. There's an online playground where you get a feel for all its¬†features.

  • üìà Perspective 3.4 ‚Äì Streaming data viz and analytics component. The core is written in C++ and compiled to WebAssembly. The homepage shows it off¬†well.

  • Happy DOM 17.3 ‚Äì Cross-runtime JS implementation of a web browser sans¬†UI.

  • EasyMDE 2.20 ‚Äì A simple Markdown editor control. Demo.

  • LogTape 0.9 ‚Äì Simple logging library for all major JS¬†runtimes.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Dropbox, Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many¬†more.

Meet Harmony - An open source library for composing consistent and highly performant platforms from independent business¬†features.

üèéÔ∏è Cut Integration Time ‚Äì CarsXE‚Äôs API ensures minimal setup and faster deployment for your project. Learn¬†more.

Working with in-app PDFs can be frustrating. Try Nutrient‚Äôs PDF SDK which handles problems effortlessly, so you don‚Äôt have to spend time fixing them. Used by ~1 billion end users in more than 150 different¬†countries.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of some of other interesting updates or useful resources in the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • üóìÔ∏è endoflife.date is a handy, updated source of 'end-of-life' dates for hundreds of open source projects, including Angular, Node.js, and Vue. A great resource.

  • Dive into WebGPU is a fantastic four part series on using the Web's most modern graphics API for creating striking visual effects.

  • FerretDB 2.0 is an interesting open source MongoDB alternative built on top of¬†Postgres.

  • A look at initial support for functions in CSS. Currently an experimental Chrome Canary feature¬†only.

item.title: „ÄêThe latest from TC39's recent meeting„ÄëTC39ÊúÄËøë‰ºöËÆÆÁöÑÊúÄÊñ∞‰ø°ÊÅØ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã724 ‚Äî February 21, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

TC39 Advances 3 Proposals to Stage 4 ‚Äî I love seeing Rob Palmer‚Äôs tweets about TC39‚Äôs progression of JavaScript proposals and this is a good roundup from this week‚Äôs meeting in Seattle. Areas covered include near-term features like Float16Array and import defer to more distant things like Math.clamp and Error.captureStackTrace entering stage¬†1.

Sarah Gooding

Deno 2.2 Released with Quality of Life Improvements ‚Äî The Deno team took a break from taking on Oracle to get a new feature-packed release of its JavaScript runtime out. We get built-in OpenTelemetry integration, linter updates, a new interactive way to update dependencies, node:sqlite support, TypeScript 5.7, V8 13.4, and much¬†more.

Iwa≈Ñczuk and Jiang

A Powerful JavaScript Reporting Tool Built for the¬†Web ‚Äî ActiveReportsJS is the premier JavaScript reporting tool designed for advanced data visualizations in web applications. With many different advanced report builders and viewers, insights can be seamlessly shared with your entire user¬†base.

MESCIUS Inc. sponsor

Interop 2025: Features Browser Devs Will Focus on This Year ‚Äî Interop is an ongoing process where browser devs cooperate on improving features in concert so more Web users can use those features sooner. This year‚Äôs focus points include the Storage Access API, pointer/mouse events, phasing out old mutation events, the scrollend event, URLPattern, and more JS/WASM¬†integration.

Nicole Sullivan (WebKit)

IN BRIEF:

  • Last year, ESLint unveiled a plan to become a more general purpose linter and added JSON and Markdown linting in due course. The latest addition? ESLint is now a CSS linter too!

  • üïπÔ∏è Running Pong across 240 browser tabs is a creative combination of AppleScript and¬†JavaScript. Next stop -¬†Tetris?

RELEASES:

  • React Native 0.78 ‚Äì Now complete with React¬†19.

  • Nano ID 5.1 ‚Äì Tiny URL-friendly unique string ID¬†generator.

  • TypeScript 5.8 RC, Node.js v18.20.7 (LTS)

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Do Lake Names Reflect Their Properties? ‚Äî I know this sounds like a geographical piece, but this developer‚Äôs curiosity led to a fun blend of JavaScript and the always useful Overpass Turbo mapping¬†tool.

Ivan Ludvig

React Officially Sunsetting Create React App ‚Äî This move has been bubbling for a long time now, but the React team is now officially recommending CRA-powered apps migrate to a framework (like Next.js) or build tools like¬†Vite.

Matt Carroll and Ricky Hanlon

Which AI Model Is Best for Fixing Unit Test Errors? Claude, o3-mini, GPT-4o? ‚Äî Better context wins every time. Wallaby enters the chat to give AI what it needs - test coverage and runtime values - to debug¬†smarter.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Why TypeScript 5.8's --erasableSyntaxOnly Matters ‚Äî ‚ÄúIt disables a bunch of features that I don‚Äôt think should ever have been part of¬†TypeScript.‚Äù

Matt Pocock

üìÑ Svelte 5 and the Future of Frameworks: A Chat with Rich Harris Frederick O'Brien

üìÑ Implementing a Dissolve Effect with Shaders and Particles in Three.js Jatin Chopra

üìÑ How to Move the First Element to the End in JavaScript Josh Sherman

üìÑ Deeply Understand Currying in 7 Minutes Yazeed Bzadough

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Mastra: A TypeScript AI Framework from the Gatsby Team ‚Äî From some of the folks behind the Gatsby React framework comes a new way to build LLM-powered agents that perform various tasks, use knowledge bases, and hold memory. Think a meta-framework like Next.js but for AI agents. GitHub¬†repo.

Mastra

upfetch: An Advanced fetch Client Builder ‚Äî A TypeScript library to enhance fetch with schema validation, automatic response parsing, and type-safety, while maintaining the familiar fetch API.

Laurent Blondy

Find. Fix. Test: An Intro to App Monitoring with Sentry ‚Äî Code-level visibility, from pre- to post-release, lets devs find and fix errors and slowdowns and deploy with¬†confidence.

Sentry sponsor

üìÑ¬†jsPDF 3.0: Client-Side JavaScript PDF Generation ‚Äî Create tickets, documents, certificates, etc. all on the fly. There‚Äôs a live demo on the project‚Äôs¬†homepage.

Parallax

Heat.js: A Heat Map Visualization Library ‚Äî Think the GitHub contributions heat map. No dependencies, small, responsive, and theme-able. There‚Äôs a live demo or its GitHub¬†repo.

William Troup

Zoompinch: A Pinch-and-Zoom Experience for Vue 3 Apps ‚Äî Designed to ‚Äòfeel native‚Äô on mobile devices. Demo.

Elya Maurice Conrad

swrv: 'stale-while-revalidate' Data Fetching for Vue 3 ‚Äî Uses a ‚Äòstale-with-revalidate‚Äô cache invalidation strategy (i.e. data is returned from cache immediately but then updated behind the¬†scenes).

Kong

ExcellentExport.js: Export Table Data to Excel or CSV ‚Äî If your app/page has some data in HTML tables and you‚Äôd like to export it to CSV or XLSX without any server involvement, this could¬†help.

Jordi Burgos

  • Ts.ED 8.5 ‚Äì Node + TypeScript framework on top of¬†Express.

  • üñºÔ∏è pixelmatch 7.0 ‚Äì Small, fast pixel-level image comparison library.

  • dash.js 5.0 ‚Äì A reference implementation for playback of MPEG¬†DASH.

  • DOCX 9.2 ‚Äì Generate .docx / Word¬†files from¬†JavaScript.

  • ApexCharts 4.5 ‚Äì Popular JS charting library.¬†(Demos.)

  • Middy 6.1 ‚Äì Node.js middleware engine for AWS¬†Lambda.

  • Size Limit 11.2 ‚Äì Performance budget tool for¬†JavaScript.

  • üîà useSound 5.0 ‚Äì React hook for playing sound¬†effects.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Learn how to build session-based authentication into a Next.js application, including the sign-in/sign-up pages, and how to protect routes.

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Dropbox, Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many more.

Design Meets Development: Amir Shalev shares his unique journey bridging the gap and seamlessly collaborating with developers using Bit.

üò∞ Is your vehicle data giving you anxiety? Mine too. That's why I built CarsXE. Now I just have existential dread. Progress! Start for Free Now!

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of some of other interesting updates or useful resources in the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • The XOR operator, and logic gate, explained. (You can use XOR yourself in JavaScript with the ^ operator.)

  • Learn Shader Programming with Rick and Morty is a fun and accessible way to learn a bit about shaders and GLSL and, in particular, rendering shapes with¬†shaders.

  • Beej, author of several popular guides to different programming concepts, has released Beej's Guide to Git, a great zero-to-expert online resource for using the world's most popular¬†DVCS.

  • Most of them don't apply to JavaScript, but I found this walkthrough of NASA's "10 rules for software development" quite¬†interesting.

„Äë

item.title: „ÄêDoom for TypeScript types„ÄëÊâìÂ≠óÁ®øÁ±ªÂûãÁöÑÂéÑËøê
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã725 ‚Äî February 28, 2025

Read on the Web

‚úèÔ∏è Whenever we include more than a few links about TypeScript, we get complaints from people who don't like it. We get that, we love you folks, and we're aware. TypeScript isn't our main focus but we do cover it, including critical pieces. That in mind, prepare yourself for our top feature... but the rest of the issue is mostly JavaScript, promise!¬†üòÖ
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

JavaScript Weekly

Developer Implements 'Doom' in TypeScript's Type System ‚Äî A curious quirk of TypeScript‚Äôs type system is that it is Turing-complete which has led some developers to implement apps entirely in the type system. One such developer has spent eighteen months producing 177 terabytes of types to get 1993‚Äôs Doom running with them. Ridiculous and amazing in equal measure, he ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†explains the project in this widely lauded 7-minute¬†video.¬†üëè

Sarah Gooding (Socket)

Functional JavaScript First Steps, v2 ‚Äî A friendly, practical introduction to functional programming fundamentals in JavaScript. Learn the power of the pure function while exploring functional programming¬†paradigms.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Bun v1.2.3 and v1.2.4 Released ‚Äî The rapid pace of progress on the JavaScriptCore-based runtime is only increasing. v1.2.3 pushes frontend dev server features (run bun ./index.html and all the bundling is done for you). bun init can now be used to create a new React project. Meanwhile, Bun 1.2.4 builds macOS apps 60% faster and macOS executables can now be code¬†signed.

Jarred Sumner et al.

What is TypeScript? An Overview for JavaScript Programmers ‚Äî You may have noticed esteemed JavaScript developer and author Dr. Axel has been on a TypeScript odyssey recently. Here he does a good job at boiling down the what (rather than the ‚Äòwhy‚Äô) of TypeScript. A handy primer on what‚Äôs going on, even if you don‚Äôt plan to use it, since you'll end up interacting with it somewhere..

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

IN BRIEF:

  • ‚≠ê The Chromium team is progressing with shipping the Observable API. This is a big deal, especially for libraries like RxJS.

  • üìä BenchJS is an online JavaScript benchmarking sandbox worth playing¬†with.

  • A look behind the scenes at recent progress on the records & tuples proposal for JavaScript (currently stage 2 at TC39). You can play with the feature here.

  • Windows 95 in Electron is, unsurprisingly, Windows 95 running in an Electron app! v4.0 adds Office 95 and IE 5.5 for some (limited) browsing of the¬†Web.

  • üìä The results of the State of React Native 2024 survey are out.

RELEASES:

  • Next.js 15.2 ‚Äì Now with a redesigned debugging experience and experimental support for React's new View Transitions API and using the Node.js runtime in¬†middleware.

  • Astro 5.4 ‚Äì Now with remote image optimization and experimental responsive image support in¬†Markdown.

  • ESLint v9.21.0 ‚Äì Now with a --ext CLI option to lint files with a particular¬†extension.

  • Ember.js 6.2, Angular 19.2, Node.js v23.9 (Current)

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

React Libraries for 2025 ‚Äî Each year, prolific React blogger Robin updates his post covering his opinionated list of essential React ecosystem libraries. He covers a lot of angles from project creation and package management through to state management, animation, form creation, auth, and¬†i18n.

Robin Wieruch

Turbocharging V8 with Mutable Heap Numbers ‚Äî The V8 team uses the JetStream2 benchmark suite to investigate performance issues and has implemented a new optimization yielding not just a 2.5x improvement in the async-fs benchmark but in other areas¬†too.

Victor Gomes (V8)

Wish Your AI Co-Pilot Actually Knew Your Codebase? ‚Äî Try the most context-aware Developer AI. Augment deeply understands your codebase, documentation, and¬†dependencies.

Augment Code sponsor

Subverting Control with Weak References ‚Äî A weak reference differs from a normal reference in that it doesn‚Äôt prevent a referenced object from being garbage collected. Most modern JS runtimes support them and James shows how they can be useful.

James Long

‚≠ê How JIT (Just In Time) Compilation Makes JavaScript Faster Royal Bhati

üìÑ Using AI in the Browser for Typo Rewriting ‚Äì A poke around one of Chrome‚Äôs newest AI¬†features. Raymond Camden

üìÑ A Mere Mortal's Introduction to JIT Vulnerabilities in JS Engines Josiah Pierce

üìÑ How to Do Visual Regression Testing in Vue with Vitest Alexander Opalic

üìÑ Why We Ditched Next.js and Never Looked Back Stewart and Snelling

üìÑ Micro Frontends with Angular and Native Federation Manfred Steyer (Angular Blog)

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Svelvet 11: Build Node-Based UIs with Svelte ‚Äî A mature Svelte component library for creating interactive node-based UIs and diagrams. v11 adds the ability to toggle between ‚Äòsnap grid‚Äô and freeform modes for manipulating elements. (There‚Äôs a live demo at the bottom of the¬†homepage.)

Open Source Labs

React Native 0.78 Released ‚Äî A big release for React Native as it ships React 19 support (which requires some tweaks when upgrading) and some more minor¬†tweaks.

Novak, Cucci, Gupta and Cipolleschi (Meta)

üîí Protect Against Bots, Fraud, and Abuse in Real Time ‚Äî WorkOS Radar protects your app with advanced device fingerprinting ‚Äî stop fake signups, free tier abuse, bot attacks and brute force attempts¬†today.

WorkOS sponsor

Random: Seedable Random Number Generator ‚Äî You‚Äôve got Math.random but this library takes things a few steps further with easy ways to create random values of various types and using different distributions (e.g. normal distribution, Bernoulli, Poisson, Pareto and¬†Weibull).

Travis Fischer

QuickJS Sandbox 2.0: Execute JS/TS in a QuickJS Powered Sandbox ‚Äî QuickJS is a small, embeddable JavaScript engine built by Fabrice Bellard and this extends it to make it easy to run code in an isolated sandboxed environment, along with some basic Node module support and a virtual file system. GitHub¬†repo.

Sebastian Wessel

  • PrimeVue 4.3 ‚Äì A UI component suite for Vue, now with a new 'theme designer' tool including a Figma-to-code¬†feature.

  • üóìÔ∏è React Big Calendar 1.18 ‚Äì Google Calendar/Outlook-like calendar¬†component. Now with React 19¬†support.

  • InversifyJS 7.0 ‚Äì Inversion of control container for¬†JavaScript. There's a v6-to-v7 upgrade guide.

  • React Markdown 10.0 ‚Äì Component to render markdown.¬†(Demo.)

  • fast-png 6.3 ‚Äì Pure JavaScript PNG image decoder and encoder.

  • Mercurius 16.1 ‚Äì Implement GraphQL servers on top of¬†Fastify.

  • Varlet 3.9 ‚Äì Material Design-inspired component library for Vue¬†3.

  • file-type 20.4 ‚Äì Detect the file type of a file, stream, or¬†data.

  • FxTS 1.5 ‚Äì Functional library for TS/JS¬†devs.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üéπ STRICH: Add blazing fast and reliable 1D/2D Barcode Scanning to your web apps. Free demo app and 30-day trial¬†available.

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by 1000s of orgs, including Dropbox, Lattice, Bilt Rewards and many¬†more.

üì£ Creators of the State of JS, Vue.js, Vite, Pino & Fastify ‚Äî have you seen the new JSNation speakers? Get 10% off with code¬†JSWEEKLY.

Bit - A build system framework for development of composable software. Natively to Harmony, and support Node.js, React apps (with Vite), NextJS, Angular, Vue and¬†more.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of some of other interesting updates or useful resources in the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • Remember Ajax? The popular term bringing together several technologies involving asychronous JavaScript making dynamic updates by calling the server was coined in this article 20 years ago this month.

  • ü§ñ Is it viable to have LLMs write alt-text for your images? Dries Buytaert put a few models through their paces.

  • GitHub is getting involved with the AI developer agent game and shows off a preview of its new Copilot 'agent mode'.

  • üåä A detailed look at the techniques behind high-performance, real-time fluid simulations with WebGPU.

  • Electronic Arts certainly doesn't make a habit of open sourcing old games, but it's just done that for 1996's Command and Conquer: Red Alert, one of the pioneering games in the real time strategy¬†genre.

„Äë
